intro: Schwantesia acutipetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Schwantesia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
